unnormalised: IIT Bombay just unveiled its latest robotics project, the 'AgriBot 1.0' and it's got everyone buzzing! The prototype, showcased at the tech fest on 10/11/2024, aims to automate farming tasks for small land holdings. Imagine, no more back-breaking labor!
normalised: I-I-T Bombay just unveiled its latest robotics project, the AgriBot one point zero and it's got everyone buzzing! The prototype, showcased at the tech fest on tenth november two thousand and twenty four, aims to automate farming tasks for small land holdings. Imagine, no more back-breaking labor!

unnormalised: This little marvel, developed by a team led by Prof. Rajesh Kumar, boasts features like automated weeding, soil analysis, and even targeted pesticide spraying. It's designed to work in farms as small as 0.5 acres. Pretty cool, huh? The estimated cost? Around Rs. 75,000/- which they are hoping to bring down further with government subsidies.
normalised: This little marvel, developed by a team led by Professor Rajesh Kumar, boasts features like automated weeding, soil analysis, and even targeted pesticide spraying. It's designed to work in farms as small as zero point five acres. Pretty cool, huh? The estimated cost? Around rupees seventy five thousand which they are hoping to bring down further with government subsidies.

unnormalised: The AgriBot 1.0 uses a combination of GPS and camera vision to navigate fields and identify crops. It can operate for 8 hrs on a single charge, making it a real game-changer. They are planning field trials in Maharashtra starting next month.
normalised: The AgriBot one point zero uses a combination of G-P-S and camera vision to navigate fields and identify crops. It can operate for eight hours on a single charge, making it a real game-changer. They are planning field trials in Maharashtra starting next month.

unnormalised: Let's hope this tech actually helps our farmers out there. With manpower shortages and increasing costs, maybe AgriBot 1.0 is just the solution we needed! More updates on this soon, folks!
normalised: Let's hope this tech actually helps our farmers out there. With manpower shortages and increasing costs, maybe AgriBot one point zero is just the solution we needed! More updates on this soon, folks!
